ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.drivers

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.team4.drivers.Navigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class Navigation
extends Thread
    Drives the robot to given waypoints using the shortest path.
    Author:
    Walid Chabchoub & Kevin Laframboise

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        Thread.State, Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean isAvoiding
      Indicates whether the robot is currently avoiding an obstacle.
      private boolean isNavigating
      Indicates whether the robot is currently navigating to a waypoint.
      private EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor
      Left motor driven by navigation.
      private Object lock
      Lock object for mutual exclusion.
      private Odometer odo
      Odometer tracking the robot's movement.
      private EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor
      Right motor driven by navigation.
      private boolean updateNeeded
      Indicates whether the path should be recalculated.

      Destination waypoint x coordinate, in cm.
      private double waypointY

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Navigation(Odometer odo, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor)
      Creates a Navigation object that will drive the given motors to waypoints, according to the position of the robot reported by the odometer.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getWaypointX() 
      double getWaypointY() 
      boolean isAvoiding() 
      boolean isNavigating() 
      void pause()
      Stops the motors and signals the Navigation algorithm that another process is taking over the driving of the robot by setting isAvoiding to true.

      Resumes the navigation by setting isAvoiding to false.

      Starts the navigation.

      Turns in given direction.
      void turnTo(double theta)
      Turns to given heading using the minimum angle.
      void update()
      Indicates to navigation that a recalculation of the path is required.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(Odometer odo,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor)
        Creates a Navigation object that will drive the given motors to waypoints, according to the position of the robot reported by the odometer.
        Parameters:
        odo - odometer tracking the robot's movements.
        leftMotor - to be driven by Navigation.
        rightMotor - to be driven by Navigation.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the navigation. Use Thread.start() to use as a thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y,
                     boolean immediateReturn)
        Travels to the given waypoint. Sets the wheel speed offset to Robot.SPEED_OFFSET.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate in cm.
        y - y-coordinate in cm.
        immediateReturn - dictates whether the method should return immediately or wait for the motor movements to finish.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y,
                     float speedOffset,
                     boolean immediateReturn)
        Travels to the given waypoint.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate in cm.
        y - y-coordinate in cm.
        speedOffset - coefficient by which the speed of the left motor is multiplied.
        immediateReturn - dictates whether the method should return immediately or wait for the motor movements to finish.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        Turns to given heading using the minimum angle.
        Parameters:
        theta - heading in radians.

      • turn

        public void turn(double dTheta,
                 String direction)
        Turns in given direction. The method will not return immediately.
        Parameters:
        dTheta - change in heading wanted, in degrees.
        direction - left or right.

      • turn

        public void turn(double dTheta,
                 String direction,
                 boolean immediateReturn)
        Turns in given direction.
        Parameters:
        dTheta - change in heading wanted, in degrees.
        direction - left or right.
        immediateReturn - dictates whether the method returns immediately

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Stops the motors and signals the Navigation algorithm that another process is taking over the driving of the robot by setting isAvoiding to true.

      • resumeNav

        public void resumeNav()
        Resumes the navigation by setting isAvoiding to false.

      • update

        public void update()
        Indicates to navigation that a recalculation of the path is required.

      • getWaypointX

        public double getWaypointX()
        Returns:
        waypointX

      • getWaypointY

        public double getWaypointY()
        Returns:
        waypointY

      • setWaypoints

        public void setWaypoints(double x,
                         double y)
        Sets the destination of the navigation. This overwrites the previous destination.
        Parameters:
        x - in cm
        y - in cm

      • isAvoiding

        public boolean isAvoiding()
        Returns:
        isAvoiding

      • isNavigating

        public boolean isNavigating()
        Returns:
        isNavigating
